column1: I'm proud to join Kentucky's Congressional Delegation to announce the Kentucky Air National Guard’s 123rd Airlift Wing was 1 of 4 units selected by the U.S. Air Force to receive a squadron of 8 new C-130J aircraft replacing its current fleet. Details: https://t.co/X8aVkKwAua https://t.co/xBCiJ70RVF
ICYMI: https://t.co/ldlknoCRHa
Happy Birthday to the United States Marine Corps! We humbly thank you for your incredible service and sacrifice. https://t.co/kg1X24oVBj
@realDonaldTrump's allegations of election fraud must be investigated to ensure the election is conducted fairly for the American people. https://t.co/FxgP2iYawq

@senatemajldr & I are pleased to announce $5.5 million in POWER grants from @ARCgov for southeastern Ky. The grants will expand opioid recovery programs spur workforce development improve STEM resources & build a new NICU in the region. Details @ https://t.co/hBSOgBkDMq
Congratulations to Colby Hall the new Executive Director of @SOAR_EKY! Learn more at https://t.co/X8aVkKwAua https://t.co/igOGcbsffK

@GovAndyBeshear & I announced $8 million in AML Pilot grants at the @SOAR_EKY Summit today.  ✅ $4.27 Million for the @pmcpikeville cancer center ✅ $4 million for King's Daughters Health System to expand - creating 250 new jobs. Learn more at https://t.co/X8aVkKwAua

High performance broadband is expanding to Beattyville Buckhorn & Livingston thanks to a $5 million investment from @usdaRD for Peoples Rural Cooperative to increase service to nearly 650 households. Congratulations! https://t.co/EFCmujMABV

This is a historic day in Kentucky as we celebrate the grand opening of @AppHarvest’s first expansive 60-acre AgTech greenhouse in Morehead Ky! I’m also pleased to announce the additional investment of $4.55 million from @usdaRD to purchase equipment for this operation. https://t.co/1G7wlrF0Yf

We’re advancing water resources in Morgan & Elliott counties thanks to over $5 million from @usdaRD. The funding will repair & replace waterlines in West Liberty + build a new water treatment plant in Sandy Hook. https://t.co/EybloBHKhW
Thank you for celebrating with us @DepSecMac! https://t.co/lliI1X1gWK

We are celebrating a historic day in southern Kentucky as the Mill Springs Battlefield National Monument becomes the 421st unit of the National Park System!   Watch live at https://t.co/2NLuFHl11X https://t.co/o9BRx5AdKT

@senatemajldr & I wrapped up the afternoon in Bell County at Pineville Community Hospital & the @KctcsSoutheast Middlesboro campus. We have worked hard to keep the doors open at both facilities to ensure local folks in Appalachia Ky have access to healthcare & higher education. https://t.co/1RNRk6uQMb

It was great to be in Barbourville today with my friend @senatemajldr Mitch McConnell. Barbourville ARH Union College Grace Community Health and other small businesses received millions in COVID-relief funding thanks to the CARES Act. https://t.co/xjvAhvRsnS

Honored to join @senatemajldr Mitch McConnell in Corbin today to announce a $15 million BUILD Grant for the City of Corbin. Federal funding will be used to improve 2 miles of U.S. 25W between KY-727 & KY-3041. The project will add four lanes medians and improve traffic flow. https://t.co/ID6oKejPbz

Great news for students in Southern Kentucky! Proud to join @senatemajldr to announce a $2.2 million grant for @SomersetCC65 to be distributed over 5 years from U.S. Dept. of Education’s Strengthening Institutions Program. Learn about new opportunities @ https://t.co/X8aVkKwAua https://t.co/SWLghYZYPl
President Trump and the First Lady are in my thoughts and prayers this morning. It is my hope that they recover quickly from COVID-19 so they can continue their critical work for the American people.

I applaud @realDonaldTrump’s nomination of Judge Amy Coney Barrett as the 9th member of the Supreme Court. He described her as having “towering intellect sterling credentials and unyielding loyalty to the Constitution.” I strongly support her confirmation to our high court. https://t.co/fJLnmrUiXR
We are extremely proud of @BBaileyWKYT in Eastern Kentucky! Best wishes in retirement. https://t.co/tCFwj7xBZ1

I was proud to introduce legislation with my Kentucky colleagues today to give the Cumberland Parkway an interstate designation between Somerset and Bowling Green Ky. Learn more at https://t.co/X8aVkKwAua https://t.co/X8atT6caaU

Tonight I voted for the bipartisan short-term funding bill to avoid a government shutdown & to ensure important federal programs continue through this pandemic including an extension of nutrition assistance for low-income families. Learn more @ https://t.co/4DHfOKpPUU

The Mill Springs Battlefield National Monument in So.Kentucky is officially part of the @NatlParkService. I was honored to participate in the ceremonial signing today in the U.S. Capitol with @Interior Sec. David Bernhardt & @senatemajldr. Great work @msba1862! https://t.co/qnCNl6E4rT

Ruth Bader Ginsburg was a bold pioneer who stood unswervingly on the principles that guided her life and the pursuit of justice. Her confidence and determination were inspiring and her legacy will undoubtedly influence future generations. https://t.co/IgVXzSnGQl

Great news for Southern and Eastern Kentucky: @centertech has been awarded a $7.8 million federal competitive grant to help expand broadband access in Southern and Eastern Kentucky. Learn more at https://t.co/X8aVkKwAua

I commend the President for facilitating this historic peace deal. This diplomatic breakthrough clears the way for expanded security cooperation increased economic integration & a more peaceful Middle East. I salute Israel & the UAE for charting this new path. https://t.co/R22WNJzWEp
Thank you @GovAndyBeshear for hosting us today in Frankfort to celebrate new jobs & opportunities for Eastern Kentucky! https://t.co/jZahnfqYMM

GREAT NEWS FOR SOUTHEAST KY:  The House just passed WRDA 2020 including an additional $40M for the USACE 531 Program to improve water & wastewater resources in our rural region - it's the largest single increase since 1996. Learn more@ https://t.co/hdJpNd5SeM https://t.co/mvE3plpvDA
Happy Birthday to @RepAndyBarr!Have a great day my friend! https://t.co/nCuofjI5wD
The House just passed the FY21 NDAA.  The legislation is far from perfect but visit https://t.co/X8aVkKwAua to learn why I voted for the bill. https://t.co/aWVuwnjLUp

His historic march for civil rights justice & equality started long before his voice thundered through Capitol Hill. While this nation mourns the loss of such a spirited champion for unity & equality his storied life will continue to resonate in the victories yet to come. (2/2)

I’ve had the distinct honor of serving in Congress with some incredible leaders but Congressman John Lewis set a higher standard for courage perseverance and compassion when he was elected to the U.S. House of Representatives in 1986. (1/2)  https://t.co/bjwaqWfkjK
The Paycheck Protection Program has been extended through August 8th! Learn more at https://t.co/jaCmO2LowU https://t.co/9BoEeqwbuf

Happy Independence Day! The signing of the Declaration of Independence in 1776 was a testament to the spirit of this great nation. May we be reminded of the founding principles that propelled our nation to rise in… https://t.co/iL2vNpLaQW
Unexpected tragedies of this measure are difficult to understand but we pray for peace and strength for the entire Barr family. (2/2)

Cynthia & I extend our deepest condolences to our friend @RepAndyBarr & his sweet daughters. Carol was always a joy to be around. She had a smile that lit up every room radiating with the love she had for her family & our state.  (1/2)
Happy Birthday to my friend Vice President Mike Pence! @VP https://t.co/MADnVmzzl7

Today we celebrate & remember more than 160000 brave soldiers who stormed the beach at Normandy 76 years ago.  Their courage and valor played a vital role in ending the Nazi empire & restoring freedom in Europe. I am forever grateful for those who paid the ultimate sacrifice. https://t.co/8CNeDIKAtM
I really enjoyed speaking with some of our young future leaders in Rowan County today! I'm inspired by their engagement and desire to improve our region in the years ahead. https://t.co/7IdYE9xYXE
@kimElam1 @RCSHSOffices @RowanSchools @KEDC1 @AspireKy I really enjoyed speaking with you and this impressive group of students! Keep up the great work with our future leaders!
Thank you @AspireKy for inviting me to chat with some of the brightest students in our region! Keep up the great work! https://t.co/vGm9ajXeDH
@AspireKy @KEDC1 Thank you for inviting me to chat with some of the brightest students in our region! Keep up the great work!

🗳Today is the last day to register to vote in Kentucky’s primary election on June 23rd!  🗳Check in with your County Clerk for updated info about voting options in the midst of the pandemic.  🗳If you haven’t already registered click the link below.  https://t.co/AgPx9a04AA

I applaud @usaid Acting Admin. John Barsa for standing strong for unborn children around the world in the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic. Mr. Barsa condemned the UN & Global HRP for advancing access to abortion as an “essential service." Read more at https://t.co/X8aVkKwAua

To all the moms who are juggling new roles through this pandemic and finding new ways to educate and entertain children at home while also teleworking in many cases we celebrate your strength and creativity. Thank… https://t.co/j9Rv0E5vP6

COVID-19 RELIEF FUNDING UPDATE: The House just passed the bipartisan Paycheck Protection Program & Health Care Enhancement Act adding more than $480 billion in emergency COVID-19 relief funds for small businesses hospitals & expanded testing. Details @ https://t.co/Vb958QsaNT
@samhsagov released $2 Million in Emergency Grants for Kentucky to address substance use treatment & serious mental illnesses during the COVID-19 pandemic. Details @ https://t.co/dNXo6GT7Lf

As fmr. Chair of Approps & Ranking Member SFOPS I have always insisted on the highest oversight of taxpayer dollars. I will work to ensure WHO takes action on transparency & desperately needed reforms. Now more than ever the health & well-being of Americans depend on it. (3/3)

Once again WHO's actions are raising red flags. The COVID-19 pandemic has required a rapid response around the globe yet this leading health organization has fallen short and its credibility continues to suffer. (2/3)

I agree with @realDonaldTrump's concerns about accountability & transparency at the World Health Organization. Last year I released a report exposing the WHO’s dangerously misleading and in some instances outright false claims about the safety & efficacy of rx opioids. (1/3)

UPDATE ON ECONOMIC IMPACT PAYMENTS:  The first stimulus deposits are being made this week. Secretary Mnuchin announced more than 80 million Americans will receive Economic Impact Payments by Wednesday April 15th. Learn more @ https://t.co/X8aVkKwAua https://t.co/RP87pfkzqk

STAY UP-TO-DATE: https://t.co/J44hhc3oPS Find details about federal resources that are now available for families and businesses in Kentucky by visiting my website along with frequently asked questions and rumor control. https://t.co/6Am93UqFfb

SMALL BUSINESS UPDATE: Applications open TODAY for small businesses and sole proprietorships to access Paycheck Protection Program loans which were a part of the CARES Act passed by Congress and signed into law by the President last week. Apply at https://t.co/AFVHJMwR59. https://t.co/LAlnU38iRV

Kentucky's Congressional Delegation sent a letter to President Trump in support of @GovAndyBeshear's request for a federal major disaster declaration as a result of deadly severe storms in February. Learn more @   https://t.co/1g3ZdiTdBc

I'm proud to see companies like SEKRI in Southeastern Ky stepping up to help w/ the shortage of personal protection gear by producing masks for healthcare workers. Special thanks to all the companies that are lending support during this pandemic! https://t.co/qnicl3xGWt

The House just passed the historic CARES Act by voice vote! I applaud my colleagues for rallying together to extend hope and much-needed funding directly to families and individuals across the country. Read my statement at https://t.co/X8aVkKwAua https://t.co/CaGpbA5Twp

One single no vote on the CARES Act will not stop this critical COVID-19 relief package. It would be a disappointing and unnecessary delay but I want to assure Kentuckians that this bill will pass despite those who choose to put politics above the American people. #PassTheBill

I applaud the Senate for passing the Families First Coronavirus Response Act the 2nd round of legislation that has now been approved by this Congress to combat the COVID-19 crisis. Learn more about our united efforts at https://t.co/R784aaJgmB.

Stay up to date on news related to the Coronavirus at https://t.co/KIEJs3hfop. If you need assistance all of my Kentucky District Offices remain open in Somerset Hazard and Prestonsburg. Office information is available at https://t.co/q4qhhAF5Su.

The House just passed the bipartisan Families First Coronavirus Response Act to help protect American families and businesses during this pandemic.  Highlights include: ✅Free testing for COVID-19 ✅Additional paid sick leave ✅Extended food aid Details @ https://t.co/X8aVkKwAua
This morning I asked Sec. Mnuchin about actions to address how the coronavirus is impacting the health of the U.S. economy. Learn more about this responses: https://t.co/5xkrv6w7Ha
ATTN HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS: We need your artwork on Capitol Hill! Who will represent So. & E. Kentucky in the 2020 Congressional Art Competition. Learn how to register here: https://t.co/2wfqL1MtE9

I'm pleased to report the release of $2 million from @USDOT's Emergency Relief program to help rebuild roads in Southern and Eastern Kentucky that were severely damaged by flooding last month. Get details here: https://t.co/RhAHlKt8c4

I convened a meeting today in Corbin to discuss flood control successes and necessary improvements with local leaders who serve communities along the Cumberland River. Learn more about our meeting at https://t.co/X8aVkKwAua https://t.co/j6n2I6u9gQ
I met with leaders from Hazard today to discuss future plans for the city. It was great to see Mayor Happy Mobelini Carlos Campbell Derrick Hall and Betsy Clemons. https://t.co/xyERqjLSGq
It was a pleasure to meet with the National Multiple Sclerosis Society’s Kentucky Government Relations Advisory Committee today including Dinah Ward from Tyner KY. https://t.co/pRbgvkew4i

The House just passed an emergency funding package to address the coronavirus at home and overseas. It will expedite vaccine development provide funds to purchase equipment and supplies & includes $1 billion for state and local response efforts. Details@ https://t.co/X8aVkKwAua https://t.co/J24HX49ShH

Today I had the pleasure to meet with the 40th Chief of Staff of the U.S. Army General James C. McConville. We discussed army modernization plans to ensure it remains the world’s premier fighting force. As a… https://t.co/oBP1zRSFYn

It is always a pleasure to welcome local leaders to Washington DC. Today I had the opportunity to meet with our friends from Corbin to discuss vital projects for the city and the entire tri-county area.  Special… https://t.co/9DtENrmqxb

The National Peace Corps Association presented me with the Sam Farr Congressional Leadership Award today. I’m honored to stand with these global advocates for peace!  @pcorpsconnect https://t.co/QlqFdBx412

I was honored to speak to my friends with @KYFB today during their annual congressional breakfast in Washington and personally lead them on a tour of the Capitol Building. We must stay focused on expanding rural… https://t.co/jbB8rPkv2f

Pleased to have @NASA Administrator @JimBridenstine at Morehead State University for the Terry McBrayer Lecture Series to encourage students and staff at the @MSUSpaceScience Karen Kelly my District Director & Adam Rice Field Rep. welcomed Mr. Bridenstine to Ky’s 5th District. https://t.co/dd1aj6oXwN

These grants help bring our coalfields full circle by providing funds to rehabilitate the same land that generated affordable power and infused our economy through coal mining for generations. Learn more at https://t.co/X8aVkKwAua. https://t.co/CjpnI9iI4h

I'm embarrassed at the Speaker's childish & partisan stunt. She showed great disrespect for the House & the President. I cosponsored H.Res.832 not only on behalf of the President & this institution but also for the American heroes & families who were honored during the speech. https://t.co/Qa8DwXaVz3

This phony impeachment process essentially held hostage much of the real work of this congressional body for months but it is finally ‘game over’ for the Democrats’ politically-motivated charade. Read my full statement on President Trump's acquittal at https://t.co/X8aVkKwAua
Pleased to welcome @marciahawkinsUC to DC today to talk about higher education in KY-05. https://t.co/TiN8rXvQ9Z

Congratulations to Jon Moore a senior at Somerset Christian School for earning the Congressional Award Silver Medal. Read how he earned the award and how you can earn one too at https://t.co/X8aVkKeZ5A.  _scs_official https://t.co/TlZcSvQLAf

I made a special trip to Frankfort today to meet with the Kentucky Mountain Caucus & @GovAndyBeshear to discuss opportunities to uplift Eastern Kentucky & improve our economy. Special thanks to Chairmen @Smithkysenate & Rep. John Blanton for their leadership on the Mtn. Caucus. https://t.co/LAAxkGroEd

Proud to receive an A rating on the @SBAList's 1st National Pro-Life Scorecard. I count it a distinct honor & duty to protect the sanctity of life & to provide a voice for our innocent unborn children. Learn more at https://t.co/X8aVkKwAua. https://t.co/L0RKtZIyoP
